gpcm.rgpcm module¶

class gpcm.rgpcm.RGPCM(*args, **kw_args)[source]¶

Bases: gpcm.model.AbstractGPCM

Rough Gaussian Process Convolution Model.

Parameters

  • scheme (str, optional) – Approximation scheme. Defaults to structured.

  • noise (scalar, optional) – Observation noise. Defaults to 1e-4.

  • fix_noise (bool, optional) – Do not learn the observation noise. Defaults to False.

  • alpha (scalar, optional) – Decay of the window.

  • alpha_t (scalar, optional) – Scale of the window. Defaults to normalise the window to unity power.

  • window (scalar, alternative) – Length of the window. This will be used to determine alpha if it is not given.

  • fix_window (bool, optional) – Do not learn the window. Defaults to False.

  • lam (scalar, optional) – Decay of the kernel of \(x\). Defaults to 1 / scale.

  • gamma (scalar, optional) – Decay of the transform \(u\) of \(x\). Defaults to the inverse of ten times the spacing between locations of data points.

  • gamma_t (scalar, optional) – Scale of the transform. Defaults to normalise the transform to unity power.

  • a (scalar, optional) – Lower bound of support of the basis.

  • b (scalar, optional) – Upper bound of support of the basis.

  • m_max (int, optional) – Defines cosine and sine basis functions.

  • m_max_cap (int, optional) – Maximum value for m_max. Defaults to 150.

  • n_z (int, optional) – Number of inducing points for \(z\). Will be used to determine m_max.

  • scale (scalar, alternative) – Length scale of the function. This will be used to initialise lam and determine m_max if m_max is not given.

  • fix_scale (bool, optional) – Do not learn the length scale. Defaults to False.

  • ms (vector, optional) – Basis function frequencies. Defaults to \(0,\ldots,2M-1\).

  • n_u (int, optional) – Number of inducing points for \(u\).

  • n_u_cap (int, optional) – Maximum value for n_u. Defaults to 300.

  • t_u (vector, optional) – Locations of inducing points for \(u\). Defaults to equally spaced points across twice the filter length scale.

  • extend_t_z (bool, optional) – Does nothing. Provided to ensure a consistent interface between all models.

  • t (vector, alternative) – Locations of interest. Can be used to automatically initialise quantities.

compute_I_hz(t)¶

Compute the \(I_{hz,t_i}\) matrix for \(t_i\) in t.

Parameters

  • model (gprv.GPRV) – Model.

  • t (vector) – Time points of data.

Returns

Value of \(I_{hz,t_i}\), with shape

(len(t), len(model.ms), len(model.ms)).

Return type

tensor

compute_I_ux(t1=None, t2=None)¶

Compute the \(I_{ux}\) integral.

Parameters

  • model (gprv.GPRV) – Model.

  • t1 (tensor, optional) – First time input. Defaults to zero.

  • t2 (tensor, optional) – Second time input. Defaults to zero.

Returns

Value of \(I_{ux}\) for all t1, t2.

Return type

tensor

compute_I_uz(t)¶

Compute the \(I_{uz,t_i}\) matrix for \(t_i\) in t.

Parameters

  • model (gprv.GPRV) – Model.

  • t (vector) – Time points \(t_i\) of data.

Returns

Value of \(I_{uz,t_i}\), with shape

(len(t), len(model.t_u), len(model.ms)).

Return type

tensor

Covariance matrix of inducing variables \(u\) associated with \(h\).

Parameters

model (gprv.GPRV) – Model.

Returns

\(K_u\).

Return type

tensor

compute_K_z()¶

Covariance matrix \(K_z\) of \(z_m\) for \(m=0,\ldots,2M\).

Parameters

model (gprv.GPRV) – Model.

Returns

\(K_z\).

Return type

compute_i_hx(t1=None, t2=None)¶

Compute the \(I_{hx}\) integral.

Parameters

  • model (gprv.GPRV) – Model.

  • t1 (tensor, optional) – First time input. Defaults to zero.

  • t2 (tensor, optional) – Second time input. Defaults to zero.

Returns

Value of \(I_{hx}\) for all t1 and t2.
